headline: Enhanced Oil Recovery Forecast Report 2025: A $68.38 Billion Market by 2033 Featuring Baker Hughes, BP, Chevron, Exxon Mobil, Halliburton, Praxair, Shell, Schlumberger, TotalEnergies, Weatherford
summary: The Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) Market is projected to grow from US$ 47.64 billion in 2024 to US$ 68.38 billion by 2033, with a CAGR of 3.04% from 2025-2033. Key drivers include aging wells, declining oilfield production, and innovative EOR techniques. EOR technologies like thermal, chemical, and gas injection boost oil extraction from difficult reservoirs, catering to rising global energy demands. Challenges include high costs and environmental concerns, but advancements in AI and sustainable p

headline: Will BASF (XTRA:BAS) Use Carbon Accounting Leadership to Bolster Its Sustainability Edge?
summary: BASF has joined a global coalition of leading industrial and financial companies, including ExxonMobil, ADNOC, Banco Santander, and NextEra Energy, to launch Carbon Measures, a standardized carbon accounting framework aimed at improving emissions tracking and transparency across supply chains. This initiative positions BASF at the forefront of efforts to set rigorous, comparable emissions standards, which could drive forward the adoption of lower-carbon technologies throughout the chemical...

headline: Wells Fargo Suggests 2 Energy Stocks to Buy in a Challenging Market
summary: There are headwinds in store for the oil industry, but a new report from Wells Fargo suggests that there are still plenty of sound options for investors. The bank sees demand as slowing, although not turning fully negative, and refining as an area of strength. The outline is simple enough: supply is sufficient, and end-product fuels should attract investor attention. Summing up this outlook, Wells Fargo analyst Sam Margolin writes, “We pick stocks based on return of capital trends, which have hi
